636850-d-06-19-09-CC.Narrative: U70691-18 WAS EASTBOUND AT 37 MPH ON SINGLE MAIN TRACK WITH 2 LOCOMOTIVES, 78 LOADS AND 36 EMPTIES,WHEN THE TRAIN WENT INTO EMERGENCY AT THE MULFORD ROAD CROSSING ACCOUNT WASHOUT DUE TO HEAVY RAINS IN THE AREA.  A TOTAL OF 19 LOADED ETHANOL (ALCOHOLS, N.O.S.) CARS WERE DERAILED. SIXTEEN OF THE CARSWERE DESTROYED AND RELEASED 323,963 GALLONS OF ETHANOL, THIRTEEN OF THESE WERE INVOLVED IN FIRE ORFLAME.  AN EVACUATION OF APPROXIMATELY 2,000 PEOPLE FOR 20 HOURS TOOK PLACE DUE TO THE HAZARDOUS RELEASE AND FIRE.  THE DERAILMENT AND ENSUING FIRE CAUSED 1 DEATH AND INJURIES TO 11 INDIVIDUALS IN THEAREA AT THE TIME OF THE INCIDENT OR RESPONDING TO THE DERAILMENT.  FRA POST ACCIDENT DRUG AND ALCOHOL TESTING WAS DONE ON THE CREW AND ALL RESULTS WERE NEGATIVE.  #11 ACTUAL NUMBER IS 2000 PEOPLE EVACUATED.  THE CARS THAT WERE DESTROYED AND RELEASED HAZMAT WERE:  CTCX 731600, CTCX 731601, CTCX 731596, CTCX 731599, CTCX 730958, CITX 224236, TILX 193772, TILX 193767, NATX 303375, NATX 303504, NATX302974, NATX 302968, NATX 303067, NATX 303174, NATX 302969.

WHILE SHOVING A CUT OF 28 LOADED TANK CARS CONTAINING FUEL (AVIATION, FUEL, TURBINE ENGINE, COMBUSTIBLE LIQUID, UN 1863, PG III), ANCHORAGE YARD JOB #438, IN A NORTHWARD MOVEMENT, STRUCK A TANK CAR CONTAINING A RESIDUE OF THE SAME MATERIAL. THE TANK CAR THEY STRUCK ON TRACK B HAD BEEN LEFT IN THE FOUL OF THE B/C TRACK SWITCH. NO INJURIES, FIRE OR LEAKAGE RESULTED FROM THIS INCIDENT. THE CREW HAD SHOVED A CUT OF 83 CARS NORTHWARD INTO THE FLINT HILLS LOOP. THE CONDUCTOR AND BRAKEMAN RODE THE POINT OF THE MOVEMENT TO THE A/B TRACKS SWITCH WHERE THE BRAKEMANDROPPED OFF AND THE CONDUCTOR CONTINUED RIDING THE POINT OF THE CARS AROUND THE LOOP ON TRACK A. THECONDUCTOR STOPPED THE MOVE WITH THE LEADING CAR AT THE END OF THE LOADING RACK. HE THEN SECURED ANDCUT OFF NINE CARS. AFTER CLEARING THE CONSTRUCTION CROSSING, THE CONDUCTOR SECURED THE CARS AND WALKED TOWARD THE A/B CROSSOVER TO PROTECT A SHOVING MOVEMENT ON TRACK C.  MEANWHILE, THE BRAKEMAN LINED THE B/C SWITCH FOR MOVEMENT INTO TRACK C, WHILE A CAR ON B TRACK FOULED THE B/C SWITCH. THE BRAKEMAN MADE  A CUT ON TRACK A, CLEAR OF THE A/B TRACK SWITCH AND THE ENGINE PULLED A CUT OF 28 CARS SOUTHWARD TO CLEAR THE SAME SWITCH.  THE BRAKEMAN THEN LINED THE SWITCH FOR MOVEMENT INTO TRACK B AND INSTRUCTED THE ENGINEER TO SHOVE NORTHWARD 15 CARS LENGTHS. AS THE LEADING CAR PASSED THROUGH THE B/C

THE INVESTIGATION DETERMINED THAT THE MOST LIKELY CAUSE OF THIS DERAILMENT WAS MISALIGNMENT OF TRACK DUE TO HEAT/SUN KINK OF RAIL UNDER LOAD, PRIMARY CAUSE CODE T109.  THE DERAILMENT OCCURRED AT 2:15 P.M. AND WAS INITIALLY REPORTED BY RADIO TO THE MANAGER AS TRAIN IN EMERGENCY AT MILE POST 100.6.  THE ENGINEER REPORTED THAT HE FELT A SUDDEN MOVEMENT, DESCRIBED AS A TUG, AND THAT HE REACHED TO APPLY THE AUTOMATIC BRAKE WHEN THE TRAIN STOPPED MOVEMENT ANDTHE EMERGENCY BRAKES APPLIED.  AT THAT TIME THE TRAIN CREW BEGAN A WALKING INSPECTION OF THE TRAINTO DETERMINE THE REASON FOR THE EMERGENCY APPLICATION OF THE TRAIN BRAKES.  UPON REACHING THE REAR OF THE TRAIN THE CREW OBSERVED SIX DERAILED CARS, FOUR OF WHICH OVERTURNED, WHILE TWO DERAILED AND REMAINED UPRIGHT. THIS INFORMATION WAS FURNISHED TO THE MANAGERS WHO TRAVELLED TO THE LOCATION OF THEDERAILMENT.  UPON ARRIVAL OF MERIDIAN SOUTHERN RAILWAY MANAGEMENT, IT WAS DETERMINED THAT THE SIX NORTH CARS OF THE TRAIN HAD DERAILED AND/OR OVERTURNED.  THE INVESTIGATION DETERMINED THAT ALL OF THEINVOLVED BRIX MARKED CARS WERE EQUIPPED WITH SHELF TYPE COUPLERS, WHICH RESULTED IN THE OVERTURNINGOF SEVERAL CARS IN THIS DERAILMENT. 211747-d-06-08-09-SOO.Primary Accident Cause: Shoving movement, absence of man on or at leading end of movement
211747-d-06-08-09-SOO.Accident Cause: Shoving movement, absence of man on or at leading end of movement
211747-d-06-08-09-SOO.Narrative: G-80 WAS IN THE PROCESS OF SWITCHING CARS BY MANKATO AVE. THE CONDUCTOR TOLD THE ENGINEER TO SHOVE BACK TO CLEAR THE CROSSING. THEY SHOVED BACK TO CLEAR THE CROSSING AT MANKATO TO LET THE CAR TRAFFICGO. THE ENGINEER STOPPED WHEN HE WAS ABOUT THREE CAR LENGTHS FROM THE CROSSING. THE ENGINEER INDICATED HE THOUGHT THE CONDUCTOR WAS WATCHING THE SHOVE BECAUSE HE COULD NOT SEE HIM, BUT IN FACT THE CONDUCTOR WAS ONLY ABOUT THREE CARS AWAY FROM THE ENGINE WHEN THEY STOPPED. THE ENGINEER THEN ASKED IFTHEY HAD GONE THROUGH THE CROSSING AT LOUISA STREET. CONDUCTOR INDICATED, NO, HE WALKED BACK TO SEEAROUND THE CURVE AND COULD SEE THAT THE LIGHTS AT THE CROSSING ON LOUISA ST. WERE ON BUT HE THOUGHTTHAT HE COULD SEE THE LAST CAR AND THAT IT WAS JUST WEST OF THE CROSSING AND IN THE CIRCUIT TO MAKETHE LIGHTS GO ON.  AFTER THE AUTO TRAFFIC CLEARED THE MOVEMENT WENT FORWARD AGAIN AND DERAILED THE REAR TRUCK OF REAR CAR DME 27300 (LOAD WHEAT). THE CAR WAS DRAGGED FOR APPROXIMATELY 1500 FEET FROM THE POINT OF DERAILMENT, DOING DAMAGE TO THE TIES, SPIKES, ANGLE BAR BOLTS. LOUISA ST CROSSING AND THE WHEELS TO CAR DME 27300.

IT WAS DETERMINED THAT THE PROX 76370 (ON ASSIGNMENT GH32) RODE UP THE SWITCH POINT PROTECTOR ON THE EAST SWTICH OF THE WEST YARD LEAD TO THE NEW ARRIVAL CROSSOVER ANDDERAILED, WHICH THEN STRUCK THE 2 CARS ON THE HUMP LEAD. 2009J056-d-06-24-09-IAIS.Primary Accident Cause: Investigation complete, cause could not be determined (When using this code, the narrative must incl
2009J056-d-06-24-09-IAIS.Accident Cause: Buffing or slack action excessive, train handling
2009J056-d-06-24-09-IAIS.Narrative:
AFTER SETTING OUT CARS ON THE BNSF FARMALL TRACK, CREW TIED BACK ON TO TRAIN ON BNSF MAIN.  WHEN CREW PULLED AHEAD, TRAIN EXPERIENCED EMERGENCY APPLICATION.  CREW FOUND FIVE CARS WERE ON THE GROUND.THE DERAILMENT WAS THOROUGHLY INVESTIGATED.  ALL POSSIBLE CONTRIBUTING FACTORS WERE CONSIDERED, AND MEASUREMENTS WERE TAKEN OF THE TRACK,  NO EXCEPTIONS NOTED.  MEASUREMENTS WERE TAKEN OF THE CARS,NO EXCEPTIONS NOTED AND THE EVENT RECORDER DOWNLOAD WAS REVIEWED FOR COMPLIANCE WITH AIR BRAKE AND TRAIN HANDLING RULES, NO EXCEPTIONS NOTED.  SINCE WE ARE UNABLE TO DETERMINE THE CAUSE, WE FEEL IT ISUNFAIR TO ASSIGN RESPONSIBILITY TO ANY INDIVIDUAL OR DEPARTMENT.  

IT IS THE IAIS'S OPINION THATAN EVENT CAUSED BY A COMBINATION OF TRACK CURVATURE/WHEEL RAIL INTERFACE AND A SMALL AMOUNT OF BUFFFORCE CONCURRENT WITH STOPPING THE TRAIN; ALL ASPECTS OF WHICH MET COMPLIANCE AND RULE REGULATIONS,CAME TOGETHER AT THE SAME TIME TO CAUSE THIS DERAILMENT.
